articles.title: Want to link from Google’s app store to your app? That’ll be $2–4 per install - The Verge
articles.description: Google will charge fees when Android developers link outside of the Play Store, or use alternative billing systems, and says it’s complying with the Epic injunction.

articles.title: This Tool Can Tell You If Your Home Network Has Been Compromised - Lifehacker
articles.description: IP Check tells you if your address is involved in malicious scanning.

articles.title: NotebookLM now uses Gemini 3, adds new ‘Data Tables’ output - 9to5Google
articles.description: NotebookLM is getting in a few more features before the holidays, including an upgrade to Gemini 3 and Data Tables.

articles.title: Gemini isn’t replacing Google Assistant on Android just yet - The Verge
articles.description: Google is pushing back its timeline for replacing Google Assistant with Gemini on Android, as it now says it will continue upgrading devices into 2026, rather than by the end of 2025.

articles.title: Nintendo Might Change The Switch 2 Feature Players Complain About Most - GameSpot
articles.description: This may be a welcome development for Nintendo Switch 2 players who hate Game-Key Cards.

articles.title: Riot Games is making an anti-cheat change that could be rough on older PCs - Ars Technica
articles.description: BIOS checks will only affect a limited subset of Valorant players for now.

articles.title: Terminator 2D: No Fate Review - Yesterday’s Battle For Tomorrow - Game Informer
articles.description: No Fate is a strong retro adaptation of a beloved film, but it is not without some design annoyances that we’ve moved beyond.

articles.description: Is this the start of an eventual competitor to the Google and Apple app stores?

articles.title: Strava puts popular “Year in Sport” recap behind an $80 paywall - Ars Technica
articles.description: Strava’s most viral feature is suddenly locked away.

articles.title: We asked four AI coding agents to rebuild Minesweeper —the results were explosive - Ars Technica

articles.title: Kojima On AI: "We Can't Go Back" - GameSpot
articles.description: "I think there isn't any point in saying 'We shouldn't use AI' or 'AI is useless.'"

articles.title: Netflix acquires gaming avatar maker Ready Player Me - TechCrunch
articles.description: The gaming startup will allow Netflix subscribers to create avatars that can extend across gaming titles.
